comment: I don't understand all that hate that this teacher is getting, she's given my class ample amount of time to do all assignments, the syllabus does change quite often, but she is definitely reasonable regarding unforeseen issues. Do your work, show up, get that A.

The majority of the work done in the semester is group work; if you have one bad group member, your grade suffers as a whole. She doesn't follow her own syllabus, she changes requirements for every assignment she makes every time class meets, and she doesn't cover anything from the textbook, which you'll be using weekly.

Doesn't follow her own syllabus, will always find fault in your work, and criticizes students for not knowing the content she is supposed to teach. The first half of the semester is solely group projects.

One time she gave the entire class a "quiz"(normally quizzes aren't 50 or 75 questions long) and everyone had a different set of questions. She doesn't cover chapters well enough for the quiz so read everything. She takes points off for literally anything. Half the time she doesn't know what is on her own syllabus. She is not clear
Doesn't know what she put on the syllabus. You really don't know what she wants from a presentation. It's a bit irritating. But the class wasn't bad. I met great people my age!
She doesn't know what she wants. She switches her work requirements on a daily basis
